choices.D: Undo the jailbreak and enable an antivirus
choices.C: Back up the files and do a system restore
choices.A: Run an antivirus and enable encryption
choices.B: Restore the defaults and reimage the corporate OS

discussion.content: Why not backing up the data before doing system restore? If the data is important, company will lose valuable assets by prematurely cleaning the device. I personally would go for C.
Fixing the underlying problem first, would be the main focus here which is undo jailbreaking, and then you can do whatever needs to be done to sort the issue
Why not D-- undo jailbreak, then enable antivirus???

Selected Answer: B
Obviously B.

Selected Answer: B
The phone needs to be restored

comments.content: Answer A does not remove jailbreak that is why for me it's answer B.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The symptoms of a high number of ads, data-usage limit notifications, and slow response on a company-owned mobile device that has been jailbroken indicate that the device has been compromised by malware.

questions.question_text: A company-owned mobile device is displaying a high number of ads, receiving data-usage limit notifications, and experiencing slow response. After checking the device, a technician notices the device has been jailbroken. Which of the following should the technician do next?
A remote user is experiencing issues with Outlook settings and asks a technician to review the settings. Which of the following can the technician use to access the user's computer remotely?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol)

RDP is the most suitable tool for remotely accessing a user's computer and reviewing their Outlook settings. It provides a graphical interface that allows the technician to see and control the remote computer's desktop, just as if they were sitting in front of it.

GG

Selected Answer: C
C. RMM (Remote Monitoring and Management)

RMM tools are specifically designed to allow technicians to remotely monitor, manage, and troubleshoot client systems. They provide the necessary access and capabilities to address issues such as Outlook settings remotely. While VPN (Virtual Private Network) can provide secure access to the network and RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) allows remote desktop control, RMM tools are more comprehensive and better suited for remote support tasks like the one described. SSH (Secure Shell) is typically used for secure command-line access to servers and would not be the best choice for managing Outlook settings on a user's computer.

C. RMM (Remote Monitoring and Management)

RMM (Remote Monitoring and Management) software enables technicians to access and manage remote computers. With RMM, technicians can remotely troubleshoot issues, including reviewing and adjusting Outlook settings, without physically accessing the user's computer.

Selected Answer: A
Plugging an unknown USB in a computer can result in several forms of cyberattacks. There's a chance that the malicious USB could infect your computer with a virus, malware, or spyware. It can lead the victim to a phishing site where the cybercriminal can lure the target into sharing their private data. It is literally called ''USB baiting''
What in the world are you talking about ''tailgating''? Stop using ChatGPT and use your own brain and do some minimal research!

comments.content: chatgtp says its evil twin lol

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This scenario describes a Phishing attack. Phishing often involves tricking the user into opening a malicious attachment or visiting a malicious site. In this case, the user received a USB device (the “prize”) in the mail, which likely contained malicious software that caused the computer to stop booting. So, the correct answer is:

A. Phishing

Selected Answer: A
Thanks Paula77, how does someone receives a prize through a mail be classified as tailgating? Read through a question before jumping to conclusion. Phishing it is, with Paula's Explanation.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct here

C. Tailgating

The situation described in the scenario, where an unauthorized USB device is inserted into a computer without the user's knowledge, corresponds to a form of attack known as "tailgating." Tailgating involves an attacker physically following a legitimate user into a secure area or accessing a system or device when the legitimate user is present. In this case, the user allowed the attacker (potentially unknowingly) to insert the USB device, which could carry malware or malicious software, into the computer.

questions.question_text: A computer technician is investigating a computer that is not booting. The user reports that the computer was working prior to shutting it down last night. The technician notices a removable USB device is inserted, and the user explains the device is a prize the user received in the mail yesterday. Which of the following types of attacks does this describe?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"The best way" - not "what should you try first?" You have to think like CompTIA. Reinstall the OS. Running a scan is better for prevention, not a solution.

comments.content:
If you have Ransomware the only way to get rid of it is to pay the attacker. Your restore point is infected with malware too, check the CompTIA malware removal steps, you remove the restore point first, and create a new restore point after the problem is solved and your PC is clean.

If the message is not a pop-up and it's a real ransomware attack, the only solution is reinstalling OS.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I don't know why you would have to reinstall the OS if you are infected with Ransomware. I chose A because your anti-virus might be able to get rid of it. If that doesn't work in the real world then move over to a system restore point.

Selected Answer: B
“Best Way”. As nobody knows if the drives been encrypted already, reinstalling os solves the issue both ways

Selected Answer: A
Doesn't make sense to use reinstall the os if you haven't try to av scan first

Read the question. It doesn't mentioned that the malware has ACTUALLY encrypted the volume. Frequently, Ransomware makes claims that aren't true in order to get you to comply and send them money. These viruses aren't sophisticated. They use the approach of sending out a massive amount of these ransomware viruses and wait for the money to come in. 

The answer is A: Run an antivirus scan. If that doesn't clear the virus, then you can restore the system.

questions.question_text: A workstation is displaying a message indicating that a user must exchange cryptocurrency for a decryption key. Which of the following is the best way for a technician to return the device to service safely?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Open the Services window:

Press the Windows key and type "services".
Press Enter to open the Services window.
Find the Print Spooler service:

Scroll down the list of services and find "Print Spooler".
Restart the service:

Right-click on "Print Spooler" and select Restart.
This will stop and then start the Print Spooler service, which can resolve many common printing issues, including those related to failed print jobs or unresponsive printers.

GG

Selected Answer: D
Instruction here: https://www.minitool.com/lib/print-spooler.html

questions.question_text: A salesperson's computer is unable to print any orders on a local printer that is connected to the computer. Which of the following tools should the salesperson use to restart the print spooler?
